comments:
20020409
1. junit 3.7
2. debug VEctorTest
3. after hitting a break point somewhere, 
go to TestCase, line 166 and select the line
4.'display'

you get this:

<log-entry date="Wed Apr 10 18:46:15 GMT+02:00 2002">
  <status
     plugin-id="org.eclipse.jdt.debug.ui"
     severity="ERROR"
     message="Internal Error"
     code="150">
    <exception
       message="Receiver does not implement selector "invoke" with 
signature "(Ljava/lang/Object;[LObject;)Ljava/lang/Object;""
       trace="
org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugException: Receiver does not implement selector 
"invoke" with signature "(Ljava/lang/Object;[LObject;)
Ljava/lang/Object;"
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.eval.ast.engine.ASTEvaluationEngine$1.run
(ASTEvaluationEngine.java:129)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:498)
">
    </exception>
  </status>
</log-entry>

Test case:

(1) Set breakpoint on line 33 in VectorTest
(2) Debug to breakpoint
(3) Select the "TestCase" stack frame - 3rd frame from the top, on line 166
(4) Evaluate the selected line "runMethod.invoke(this, new Class[0]);"

Error message appears, which is wrong - the receiver does implement the method.
Fixed. We weren't generating the correct signature for array types.

traces.message: Receiver does not implement selector  "invoke" with signature "(Ljava/lang/Object;[LObject;) Ljava/lang/Object;"
